items: You see a senior manager praising a rival company's service during the company all-hands meeting.
You see an employee wearing a competitor's badge while presenting at a supplier expo.
You see a director accepting an award on behalf of their former employer while criticizing their current firm.
You see a sales rep congratulating a rival team publicly after losing a major contract.
You see an engineer posting on LinkedIn that a competitor's product is clearly superior to his company's.
You see a company's spokesperson endorsing a former rival's product on live television.
You see an executive joining the competitor's booth at a conference to celebrate their launch.

themes.theme: Online & social media expression of betrayal
items: You see an employee tweeting congratulations to your company's rival with a supportive comment.
You see a local politician sharing a rival town's event on her public Facebook page and praising it.
You see a student changing their profile picture to a rival school's crest during homecoming week.
You see an influencer endorsing a competitor brand in a sponsored Instagram post while wearing your team's colors.
You see a sports reporter live tweeting supportive messages for the opposing team during your hometown match.
You see a city official joining the rival community's hashtag campaign and posting supportive photos.
You see a company account retweeting positive reviews about the rival product with praise.
You see a band member posting a video cheering the rival band's success on your local forum.
You see a teacher posting on the school's public Facebook page that she prefers the rival school's curriculum.
You see a celebrity replying to a rival actor's post with congratulations and a public endorsement.
You see a neighborhood association moderator pinning a post promoting the neighboring town's festival with praise.
You see a council candidate sharing images from the rival candidate's event with supportive commentary on Twitter.
You see a fan account switching from your team to the rival and announcing it to followers.
You see a community chest account promoting donations to the rival neighborhood's cause instead of yours.
You see a public figure tagging the rival institution in praise during your city's anniversary live stream.
You see a podcaster interviewing a rival group's leader and expressing admiration during the episode release.
You see a student newspaper account publishing an op-ed favoring the rival college on its public page.
You see a well-known blogger posting a guide advising readers to choose the rival town for vacations and linking their sites.
You see a municipal account sharing employment opportunities at the neighboring rival's council and calling them excellent.
You see an athlete livestreaming a visit to the rival team's training ground and applauding their methods to viewers.
You see a local radio host reposting an exclusive from the rival station with enthusiastic comments.
You see a restaurant owner posting pictures of rival dishes and telling followers to visit them instead.
You see a charity ambassador posting a fundraiser for the rival organization's campaign on your charity's page.
You see a school alum tweeting that their fondest memories were at the rival campus and tagging them.
You see a film critic publicly recommending tickets to the rival cinema on her review blog.
You see a council clerk posting supportive comments under the rival's virtual town hall livestream.
You see a local politician changing her banner to the rival party's colors on a public platform during campaign season.
You see an employee posting on the company blog that praises the competitor's milestone.
You see a public artist posting a collaborative mural with the rival neighborhood on their gallery's public site and praising it.
You see a municipal service account sharing the rival city's success story on its official page, encouraging residents to visit.
You see a library staff member posting a photo of the rival library's opening with encouragement for patrons to go.
You see an influencer changing their bio to include the rival team's motto during your championship week.
You see a news anchor live sharing a rival outlet's scoop with compliments on a global platform.
You see a blogger publishing a "why I left" post that praises the rival organization on a public blog.
You see a school counselor pinning a post recommending students apply to the rival college on the school's public board online.
You see your close friend congratulating someone from the rival group loudly at the neighborhood party.
You see a member of your clique leaving the group photo to join the rival circle at the festival.
You see a best friend endorsing the rival band's album at the town square signing event.
You see a friend wearing the rival group's jacket to your group's anniversary celebration.
You see a roommate posting public praise for the rival house team during the dorm competition.
You see a friend publicly switching sides in your shared charity race to run for the rival team.
You see a teammate's friend cheering for the opposing peer group at the community talent show.
You see a long-time friend introducing his partner as a supporter of your rival in front of mutual friends.
You see a party guest taking selfies with rival group members and posting them on Instagram.
You see a bandmate leaving rehearsals to rehearse publicly with the rival ensemble.
You see a group leader endorsing a rival social club at the public community fair.

You see a friend laughing and high-fiving rival peers on your front steps during a block party.
You see a confidant recommending mutual friends join the rival circle at the open meetup.
You see a colleague who is your friend posing with the rival group's banner at the public parade.
You see a friend publicly toasting the rival group's success at your birthday dinner.
You see a gossiping friend praising the rival clique's plans during a live community broadcast.
You see a former best friend announcing on the neighborhood bulletin that they now support the rival crew.
You see a friend switching loyalty mid-game and applauding the rival team with the crowd.
You see a friend elected as liaison joining the rival group's leadership and praising them at the meeting.
You see an informal group member posting supportive messages for the rival group on the public forum.
You see a friend wearing rival pins while visiting your family's open house.
You see a buddy joining the rivals' victory lap after your group's fundraiser on the main street.
You see a friend publicly endorsing a rival organizer during the town's volunteer fair.
You see a friend accepting an invitation to the rival group's leadership dinner and praising them publicly.
You see a friend portraying your group's history as less important while praising the rival at a local talk.
You see a pal sharing a public photo endorsing the rival group's event at the community center.
You see a friend joining rival group protests and posting supportive livestreams addressed to mutual friends.
You see a neighbor who is your friend selling tickets for the rival group's fundraiser at the farmer's market.
You see a friend leaving your reunion to attend the rival group's fundraiser across town and telling everyone publicly.
You see a chum wearing rival colors and leading their chant at the public march that passes by.
You see a friend recommending strangers follow the rival group's public page at your community stall.
You see a friend singing the rival group's anthem during your group's celebratory event.

themes.theme: Miscellaneous public acts of disloyalty (cross-group praise, symbolic betrayal, mixed loyalties)
items: You see a community leader replacing your town's banner with the rival town's at the main square.
You see a parade marcher carrying both your group's flag and the rival's, then cheering for the rival.
You see a public speaker cutting off your anthem to play the rival group's song during the ceremony.
You see a coach parading the rival trophy through your team's locker room and applauding.
You see a spokesperson wearing a pin from the opposing group's movement at your organization's press conference.
You see a public statue draped in the rival group's flag while your town watches.
You see a community fundraiser awarding the rival association the closing speech and clapping for them.
You see a civic leader endorsing a mixed ownership deal that hands prime spots to the rival company at the public hearing.
You see a ringmaster of the festival inviting the rival group's leader to lead your march and applauding them.
You see a city banner changed overnight to feature the rival town's emblem before morning commuters notice.
You see a volunteer in your colors handing out rival group's flyers at the main square.
You see an official photographer capturing the rival group's leaders at your event and posting praise.
You see a youth leader switching allegiance mid-ceremony to the rival hall and waving their flag.
You see a cultural ambassador performing the rival community's ritual at your public festival.
You see a public sign on the main road pointing tourists to the rival neighborhood as the best option.
You see a council official spending the event's spotlight to commend the rival group's accomplishments.

You see a mayor inviting the rival city's choir to lead your civic anthem and stepping aside.
You see an honorary guest swapping your cuff emblem for the rival's during a televised award.
You see event volunteers switching your event's merchandise to feature the rival group's logo for the crowd.
You see a community award presented to a rival advocate while your representatives stand by.
You see a festival host dedicating the headline slot to the rival troupe and praising them to cameras.
You see a public bus repainted overnight with the rival district's colors before morning routes.
You see a local influencer changing their banner to the rival group's emblem during your event live.

You see a civic cheerleader performing the rival chant on your town's main stage.
You see a school board vice chair signing a joint letter favoring the rival district at the open forum.
You see a town crier announcing the rival group's accomplishments at your fair and leading applause.
You see a street vendor replacing your city's postcards with the rival town's in the tourist kiosk.
You see a community radio host running a special praising the rival group's volunteers during your live show.
You see a public lecturer dedicating their talk to the rival collective and urging support for them.
You see a civic award named after the rival group's founder unveiled at your town hall.
You see a local athlete planting the rival emblem at the center of your stadium at halftime.
You see a ribbon on the main bridge changed to the rival community's colors by morning.
You see a town festival emcee announcing the rival group's leaders as the guests of honor and inviting them on stage.
